Description: Small, dark brown, circular, clay oil lamp. Black glaze. The lamp has a round pouring hole at the centre, framed by a raised discus. Protruding from the body is short triangular nozzle with sloping sides and a rounded point. The nozzle has a round hole at the centre. Exterior covered with a shiny "glaze" (dilute in spots) that is mottled from black (no Munsell) to Dark Brown (5YR 3/4). Very well levigated Reddish Yellow (5YR 6/6-6/8) clay with occasional sand-sized white grit and micaceous inclusions. Fragment and abraded.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Great Temenos, South Mound 1020 N.I.1.35 Phase NW2B
Curator's comments: Parallel from Naukratis (Champaign, Spurlock Museum, University of Illinois 1912.01.0053). Late 4th to (probably early) 3rd century BC parallels from Alexandria (Blondé 1998, 314-22, no. 3, but see also 17 for rim). 3rd century BC parallels from Tell Atrib (Młynarczyk 2012, type TA 1.4, see also TA 1.1). Blondé, F. 1998. Lampes tournée Hellénistiques du Musée D’Alexandrie, in Empereur, J-Y. (ed.), Commerce et Artisant dans l’Alexandrie Hellénistique et Romaine, Paris, 307-35. Młynarczyk, J. 2012. Tell Atrib 1985-1995. Vol. 3: Terracotta oil lamps. Varsovie : Éditions Neriton.
Bibliographic references: Leonard 1997 / Ancient Naukratis: Excavations at a Greek Emporion in Egypt, Part I: The excavations at Kom Ge’if. (pl. 7.4; pg. 289)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KD.002) (Phase 3)
